Notes: No provided ontology path directly maps to a technical row identifier. However, row_id can serve as the local identifier for the DrugPrescription instance (i.e., the subject of the RDF statement), typically as the local part of the entity URI. No 2-hop path is available for this role.

patient_id represents the link between the prescription and the patient. Path 1 (hasPatient) is the direct link. There are no 2-hop paths from DrugPrescription to Patient or via hasPatient, so this is optimal.

The medication_atc_code is an ATC code, which is a standardized code for drugs. Path 5 (hasCode) links DrugPrescription to Code. There's also path 6 (hasCode => Terminology), but unless the code system (e.g., ATC) is required, mapping directly to Code is most appropriate. No more specific 2-hop path for ATC code.

diagnosis_code refers to the medical reason for prescribing the drug. Path 12 (hasIndicationToStart => Diagnosis) is the most semantically accurate. There is an alternative (path 13) to Intent, but the code itself is a diagnosis, not an intent.
creation_date is the datetime when the prescription was created. Path 18 (hasDateTime) is the direct link for this timestamp. No 2-hop path offers a more specific mapping.

times_a_day indicates how often the drug is to be administered per day. Path 11 (hasFrequency) links to Quantity, matching the semantics. No 2-hop path from hasFrequency leads to a more specific type.
dosage describes the amount of drug per administration. Path 10 (hasDrugQuantity) is specifically for the quantity of drug prescribed. No 2-hop path from hasDrugQuantity; this is optimal.
